snippet: President Obama said allowing cities to provide high-speed Internet would lower the cost and help break what he called a near monopoly in some markets.
abstract: Pres Obama announces executive actions he will take to expand access to high-speed Internet and to make it cheaper; announcement comes in Cedar Falls, Iowa, where he also calls on Federal Communications Commission to override state laws blocking communities from providing high-speed Internet access; telecommunications industry says Obama's actions amount to circumventing Congress and state lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: President Obama said allowing cities to provide high-speed Internet would lower the cost and help break what he called a near monopoly in some markets.

headline.main: Obama Announces Moves to Encourage Expansion of Public Broadband Networks
headline.print_headline: Obama Announces Moves to Encourage Expansion of Public Broadband Networks
